website_summaries.verdict: Many buyers marveled at the comfort, fit, support, and performance of the Vionic Walker Classic. Many of them tried the shoe upon the recommendation of a podiatrist and were delighted with the result. On the downside, not everyone was pleased with the shoe's style and overall stiffness.
pros: A large number of buyers valued the comfort and support that the Walker Classic provided for extended periods of walking and standing
The shoe’s support helped a lot of wearers in eliminating the pain associated with flat feet, plantar fasciitis, arthritis, and other foot conditions
Many consumers were pleased that the trainer was well-fitting right out of the box
cons: Some people complained that the footwear felt too stiff and required a break-in period
A handful of purchasers were not pleased by the style of the shoe: some deemed it as old-fashioned and clunky while others wished for more color options to choose from
There were multiple complaints about the stitching coming apart after a few months of wear

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Manufactured, Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: These shoes, while they have amazing arch and heel support, are otherwise poorly made. The rubber pulls away easily, the stitching started coming loose after a few weeks, and the leather separated from the sole, all within four months. Since it was summer, I didn’t wear them as often as other seasons. I bought these shoes after reading recommendations from users and an article highlighting the excellent support for high arches. Unfortunately, I spent more money on these shoes than I ever have, yet they lasted far less time. I’m so disappointed and frustrated. I wish the arch and heel support was inside a better quality, better manufactured shoe. I included pictures showing some of the issues described.
customer_reviews.author: J&J

customer_reviews.title: Very Supportive , but Order Up One Size!
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a good arch support for his job where he is on his feet all day. After some googling I found this shoe to be most recommended. I also wear Vionic for my over pronation issues too and these shoes have made all the difference for my poor feet. My son generally wears an 11 in athletic shoes so I ordered a 11.5 and a 12 since I read on the Vionic web site that you should order one size up on these. After trying both pairs he decided a whole size up (the 12) was the best fit. Vionic was right, order a whole size up. He wore them to work and he said, "So much better!"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoes blowout in less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Vionic shoes for years. A faithful customer! But the last 3 pairs that I have bought, have blown out on the sides in less than 5 months. The quality of these shoes have gone down hill. When I started wearing them 4 or 5 years ago, they lasted much longer. Totally not worth $99. My last pair lasted 4 months. Very dissapointed. I'm no longer going to buy these, even though they make my feet feel better. It totally bums me out, because I like the shoes. Now, I have to start looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Although I love the grey color and suede fabric, the shoes have a cheap feel to them. Since I started having foot issues a year or so ago, I have purchased many pairs of shoes, and most of them have been less expensive and had a sturdier feel to them. These just don't feel as supportive as I expected for a well known orthopedic brand, and although I have only worn them a few times, I have the impression that they will wear out quickly. If you're looking for quality orthopedic shoes, I would recommend buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rick313

customer_reviews.title: Order at least a half size larger
customer_reviews.text: An extra half size should be enough and a full size would be to long for me. But even with the "W" designator, they are a little snug. But I've worn these shoes every day during my morning 50 minute (30 cardio walking, 20 free weights) workout for 50 days now and have experienced no significant discomfort. I do think the inside sole could be smoother (feels slightly lumpy). I have also worn these several time simply out walking or shopping for several hours and, again, no significant discomfort. They appear well-made, so I hope they'll last despite some of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: richlife

customer_reviews.title: Size runs 1-1.5 sizes smaller than stated.
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased these I read that they run small, so I ordered a size larger. I wear 11.5 wide or 12 reg, I ordered a 13 and was able to get my foot in the shoe but my toes were up against the toe of the shoe. It felt like an 11, definitely not a 13. Other than that the shoes look like good quality but I wasn't able to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: JohnP

customer_reviews.title: Vionic Shoe for Plantar Faciatis
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because of the bunion on my left foot. I wore it on a short walk, and it wasn't a good pair for me to walk in. The width is 9.5 4E. It's wide but the fake uppersoles dug into the top part of my left food that hurts. The shoe is heavy to me. My feet hurt after a 1.5 mile walk. My arch with the bunion hurt because I'm also flat-footed. I decided to keep the pair of shoes and only use them for the grocery store or short, sort walks.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleMacy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For Me!!
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't like these i actually return these I only bought these cause the reviews I have plantar fasciitis and i was hoping that shoe would help me out which it didn't I dont know if i gave it enough time?? My feet are pretty picky so i usually can tell if I'm going to like the shoe within the first 10 steps I do stay on my feet at work 8+ hours a day so thats something to think about Maybe ill try them again but probably not
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: sizing is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered normal size for my dad (8.5 W), too small. Ordered a whole size larger and wider. Still very tight. Not sure if these are miss marked or what as they fit the same! Very dissapoionted and afraid to try again. Dad has back problems and I was really hopeful these would help.
customer_reviews.author: Chameleonblu

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried to find the a sneaker with a lot of support and good arch, these have both. I was starting to get planter fasciitis again and these were the third pair that I have tried. Considering all the walking I do these are a good quality sneaker that does not look like the typical old fart sneaker but more like the traditional tennis shoe. I’m able to walk in comfort again and wake up the next morning without agonizing foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: You only have two feet ... and they are what gets you from point A to point B ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit was snug and tight at first but the shoes will loosen up with time. This is the sixth or seventh time I have ordered these shoes. Company seems like it keeps changing names. These shoes are great with the arch support and allow me to continue longer than without. I believe that people that suffer from Plantar fasciitis would experiencemore comfort wearing and walking in these shoes. I will purchase them again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for relief from plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe so far but only wore this pair for one days far. Feel good out of box. I had to return a previous pare as they were way to small. Want to warn you that they run small and you will need at least a half size larger than you usually wear and I had to go to a wide shoe to be comfortable since they are very narrow. Will update review in a week or so after some experience. I hope to get some relief from plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: CFF

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable and snug fitting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for help with plantar, arch, ankle, knee, and lower back issues. Immediate help with foot, ankle, and back pain! I ordered my normal size and they fit very good, with minor snugness around the ankle and toe areas (but not uncomfortable). Great shoes! We will see how they wear over time, but for the past two months they have held up very well during heavy walking.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet and do a lot of walking at work. I would come home and my feet would hurt so much and no pain meds helped. I bought these shoes and never again have my feet hurt like that again. I have flat feet, heal spurs, and plantars Fasciitis. Best shoes ever! I ware them 3-5 times a week for 8-10 hours a day and I have had them for 8 months and they still feel comfortable
customer_reviews.author: j tucker

customer_reviews.title: Like the shoes a lot! But...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. I have back challenges. Walking 25-30-miles a week, I have not had any resulting back pains with these shoes... however, I always wear size 13's, but after the first week, my toes were still touching the ends. The company would not allow them to be returned because I hadn't purchased them directly from them. However, Amazon did, so I ordered size 14's... They fit well... the sizes don't seem to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive lesson.
customer_reviews.text: Buyers Beware! These are my second pair and they just fit funny. I figured I needed to break them in, but my socks kept gathering under my foot and I found that I was walking on the outside of my foot. I tried to get a exchange and it was past there 30 day return policy. So I'm stuck with a expensive pair of shoes that are going in the trash. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not the same shoe as they once were
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened to this product but I have purchased my last pair of these shoes. When I started wearing them 3-4 years ago they were great comfortable and lasted a couple of years. The last 2 purchases are in question though they are not constructed the same and within 6 months they were separating from the sole and were worn out. I am on my feet all day long and they are very comfortable but it seems they are made much cheaper nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe runs small
customer_reviews.text: I love Vionic shoes and finally convinced my husband to try their walking shoes. He has a wide foot and normally wears a 11.5 wide shoe. Reading the reviews, I ordered a size 12 wide. He liked the shoes but they were too short. I reordered a size 13 Wide and they fit great. I appreciate the fast refund to my account and no charge return shipping. I wish Vionic had more styles in a wide width for men.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: Chinese shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wound up buying and returning these 3 times. I really wanted to like them but it was not to be . First pair to small and too narrow ( my normal size). Second pair half size larger , way to narrow. Return them and ordered Wide in my size. They sent me the regular size not the wide. I GIVE UP. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Xgrdh

customer_reviews.title: Laces
customer_reviews.text: Could they possibly make the laces just a few inches longer? Another inch or two and I can wrap the laces around my waist and still have enough to tie them. Seriously, why are the laces so long? Other than that, the shoes are comfortable, as long as you follow the advice to order one size larger.
customer_reviews.author: PSebelist

customer_reviews.title: Probably most immediately valuable purchase all year
customer_reviews.text: Second day of wearing them, and my PF already has measurably improved. This is pretty amazing, given that it took months of physical therapy to get me to plateau on a level of slight pain with no further improvement. I ordered mine half a size too large based on other feedback and the shoes feel slightly too large, so the issue with sizing might have been fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but don't last.
customer_reviews.text: Good as long as they last. Trouble is they don't last long. About every three months I had to buy another pair because the sides blow out. No more. For the money they should be much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

customer_reviews.title: Happy with these Vionic shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Vionic sandals that fit my narrow foot well that I’m happy with, so I thought I would try these...and I am satisfied as well. As with other Vionic’s, they run a half size small. Someone commented that they thought the arch support was a little back toward the heel and I can see how they might. But it still provides good support and is comfortable. The insole seems a little stiff except at the heel but there is a lot of cushioning underneath. With moderate foot and joint pain from RA a normal occurrence for me, I’m very happy with these walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: traveler

customer_reviews.title: Wear 10.5 got 12's and they fit perfect.  Now I can walk miles and not hurt.
customer_reviews.text: Had to exchange first pair since even though I read reviews to buy size up, I ended up having to buy 1 1/2 size up. Usually wear a 10.5, had to get a 12 and they fit great. Walk about 2 miles each night and these are saving my feet now, I have plantar fasciitis bad. Got the white/navy and they look nice. Seem like they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: They fit great and I have to say my heel pain dropped ...
customer_reviews.text: I was wearing Sketchers for the longest time and adding high end inserts to them and they weren't working for my heel pain. After researching these I followed the advice of buying a size bigger than normal. They fit great and I have to say my heel pain dropped from an 8 to a 1 or 2 in less than a week. They're only a few months old and are holding up well so the complaints of them falling apart haven't been a problem for me yet. If they can last a year I will be buying these for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: eric t clayton

customer_reviews.title: They really work for plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders for my plantar fasciitis. Only took a day or two to get use to. I can walk again without pain or limping. The shoe is well made, solid and fits nicely around my feet. I have never paid this much for a shoe but if you suffer from plantar fasciitis it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Man

customer_reviews.title: Firm and Supportive yet Still Quite Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what to expect with these when I ordered, and have thus far been pleasantly surprised. I went with the advice of other reviewers and bought a size up from my normal 9.5. While I am using another set of arch supports on top of the stock Vionic inserts the shoes are still a touch bigger than expected. I would say that perhaps a half size up might have been more accurate for me. Will continue to update this review as the shoes wear in but thus far I am pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: ... me of the quality of the shoes and how comfortable they are and my first introduction of vionic was ...
customer_reviews.text: My mom buys vionic shoes off of qvc and she has told me of the quality of the shoes and how comfortable they are and my first introduction of vionic was a pair of Active Maximum Support Insoles I purchased from belks and I fell in love with the insoles and now that I've had the shoes I'm in absolute heaven, I work for Wal-Mart and these shoes are an absolute god send I wish I could have found them sooner Thank You Vionic.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: I reordered a full size larger and they fit fine. I have Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to the reviews that say they run small. they do! I reordered a full size larger and they fit fine. I have Plantar Fasciitis, and these shoes along with regular taping have really made a huge difference in my life. i can now walk pain free. i will say they do not last very long the side seam split after a few months. still wear them for knock around shoes, and they really make a big difference. I think i may take the insole out and use in a different pair of shoes however and see if that works just a well.
customer_reviews.author: george cothran

customer_reviews.title: I teach and am on my feet for 6 hours pretty much continuously
customer_reviews.text: No break-in necessary. Even with wide size toe box is usually still narrow. When I get wide enough in toe box, heel size too wide. These fit very well. Only very slight tightness in toe box. Definite arch support. I teach and am on my feet for 6 hours pretty much continuously. The shoes were comfortable first day. I like my New Balance walkers but these are slightly better. Plantar Fasciitis and Achilles tendonitis symptoms are slightly mitigated. No regrets on purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William R McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Broken loops, but not anything to run away from.
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but there is a problem with the quality of the workmanship. On both shoes, the middle cloth loop has broken. I've decided to cross the laces around the broken part, and will keep these shoes for their comfort and look (I don't see the ortho label under long pants). Overall a helpful shoe, just too bad that they aren't well put together.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Boyett

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: did not support well for my weight. my feet hurt
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Henricksen

customer_reviews.title: VERY glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and he loves them. We are commercial cleaners and being on our feet every night for years has destroyed our heels! Tried many inserts, different kinds of shoes, etc. Finally went out on a limb and tried these. A little pricey so we were worried, but he loves them. He can clean all night on his feet and never comes home complaining about heel pain. Worth a try! Save your money on all the drugstore inserts. I ordered him a size up though because I read all the reviews. VERY glad I did. He's normally an 11 and I got him a 12 and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: LWlovesmyMan

customer_reviews.title: Size is very decieving
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 11D Shoe was very tight, returned for size 11.5 still tight. returned for size 12. Still tight. Got out tape measure and discovered inside shoe length was only 10.5 in out side length was 12 in. my foot is an 11.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Shoes Way Too Small
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look well constructed but sizing is a major problem. I have always worn a size 12 men's shoe, but these were so small I couldn't even get my feet completely inside. The size of the Vionics appears to be about 2 sizes smaller than what they should be.
customer_reviews.author: Yambobo

customer_reviews.title: Need More Cushion in the Heel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two pair of these due to my Plantars Fasciitis, one for inside and one for outside. Disappointed in the lack of heel cushioning. After a month there has been no improvement in my condition. They are well constructed with a nice arch but again, they did not help me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eliott Ness

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with foot problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to deal with the ever increasing pain from bunions, after seeing recommendations on another site. After two months they are no better than new balance at half the price and are causing even more pain now. They are a little on the snug side even with the wide size.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Ukura

customer_reviews.title: Vionic “may be” my new favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Early indications are that this is a really, really, REALLY good shoe for sufferers of plantar fasciitis. But it’s only been less than a week wearing them, so really need more time in them to make a better evaluation. And the Vionic website has a lot of practical advice and info about the plantar fasciitis condition. A lot of different shoe purchases may be in my future from Vionic because they offer multiple styles. But again, it’s early. Give me a month in them and I’ll know more.
customer_reviews.author: SciFi Reader93

customer_reviews.title: These run very small but great for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy a 2nd pair because they run very small. I normally wear a 10.5 or 11. I bought an 11 that felt snug but I gave them time to stretch by wearing them. They didn't stretch so I bought 11.5. Great for my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.author: Frank B.

customer_reviews.title: Hurt to wear them
customer_reviews.text: Its just not that comfortable it actually hurt to wear them not that happy. Wore them once. So maybe I have not broke them in good. But for all the hype these shoes get on qvc and and in there add I didn't like them.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Shoe to Wear if you are a Diabetic
customer_reviews.text: I'm an insulin dependent Type 1 Diabetic and walk 3 - 6 miles a day. I purchased a pair of shoes from Foot Smart several years ago and they were great. I tried to purchase the same shoe again, but they were not available. I saw these shoes, BIONIC Brand, on your pages and purchased them. I have only had them for a couple of months and they are worn, but also cause problems for my toes. The shoe is too short or something and has caused me to have blisters on both big toes.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C. Zurcher

customer_reviews.title: Almost walking on a Cloud!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband who has juvenile diabetes and he's in heaven! Took a couple of hours for his feet to adjust to correcting what bad shoes have been doing to his feet, but he loves them! Correcting the heel position, toes are not cramped after 4 or 5 hours- they are cradled. Instep is perfect! Must buy more!
customer_reviews.author: BroncoKat

customer_reviews.title: Great support and good looks
customer_reviews.text: I have Vionic thong sandals which have done wonders for my Plantar Fasciatis, so I have been looking for one of their walking shoes... these have more than met my expectations and have made a big difference in my walking both for my feet and for my knees and hips. The Orthodics correct your walk and your ability to be on your feet. I recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Changed sizing
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears these to work. The first pair we received about 6 months ago was a 11W, and fit fine. Just ordered another pair, same size and it was too small. Same exact shoe. So I then returned that one and ordered an 11.5W and it fits fine. I guess they changed the sizing mold or something, but order 1/2 size larger now. Great shoes, helps people with back/foot problems while standing all day!
customer_reviews.author: Laura L Hall

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit so well and feel sooo great that my husband said he will only wear Orthaheel ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these sneakers for my husband for his birthday. He has a high instep on one foot due to a break in his teens. These shoes fit so well and feel sooo great that my husband said he will only wear Orthaheel shoes from now on. He was wearing expensive orthotics in all of his shoes made to fit from his foot doctor. I told him too wear his new Orthaheel sneakers without his orthotics and they feel wonderful all day. He is sold on Orthaheel!!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg D. Long

customer_reviews.title: Look like old man shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have hard to fit feet, but even if these fit perfectly I wouldn't have kept them. Even my dad would make fun of me in them.
customer_reviews.author: DenaMan

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction, unsure whether the loop was suppose to ...
customer_reviews.text: Trashy shoes, the nylon shoe string loop was broken/not fastened right out of the box, I got one shoe on my foot and tried to lace it up before I realized the loop wasn't connected. Poor construction, unsure whether the loop was suppose to be glued or stitched. Returned them to FootSmart noting that they were defective, they charged $15.15 for the return of defective shoes, no free return. I won't ever do business with FootSmart again, they are not a reputable vendor to do business with online.
customer_reviews.author: droberts57

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet at work 8-9 hours a day on concrete. I have tried every brand of shoes. These are the only shoes I keep going back to. They have good arch support and excellent heel cushion. Worth the extra money paid to not have your feet killing you by the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Whitemule71

customer_reviews.title: My feet feel fine and the shows still feel nice
customer_reviews.text: I’ve walked 53,000 steps in the last 2 weeks. My feet feel fine and the shows still feel nice. I’m wear a 10.5 so that is what I ordered. They fit great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Murray

customer_reviews.title: easy on the feat
customer_reviews.text: Was having metatarsal foot pain. the shoe helped me get through the chronic pain . I did wear them out in two months however, i did have them on every day and night. this is my second pair. My feet are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ottosmash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe for a variety of foot issues
customer_reviews.text: I buy these shoes for my teen son who has a serious over pronation of both feet. We are on the third pair and his feet have improved greatly, as has his stride and running ability. As long as I can find these shoes, I will be buying them for my son. I also have been buying the women's version for three years now after suffering from Plantar fasciitis. I was able to walk without severe pain for the first time in 2 years as soon as I put on the first pair. I would recommend these shoes (and the ladies version) to anyone suffering from foot misalignment, plantar fasciitis, or any other foot/heel related problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased many times
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son who walks up to 15,000 steps a day at work and is hard on shoes. He finds them comfortable and this is about the fourth or fifth pair. They last about 6 months. I also have purchased for myself for years and plan to continue doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Chinn

customer_reviews.title: Over-rated product?! Better to buy Insoles and probably much cheaper Shoes that will serve the purpose!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the shoe base itself having arch and heel support built-in but it is only the insole that is contoured. With insoles for Arch support and heels cushioning available from many companies at reasonable prices like Spenco, this shoes is certainly over-priced and I do not think it is value for money. The color as on the picture appears more on darker brown shade than what the actual show is - it is much lighter brown, more lighter than what I prefer and expected.
customer_reviews.author: VS Rao

customer_reviews.title: way too small
customer_reviews.text: I cant rate these accurately because they were so small I could not even try them on. I wear a 13 in just about every other brand. These were closer to a 10-11 if I had to guess. they looked like quality shoes. I wish they were larger.
customer_reviews.author: David M Overcast

customer_reviews.title: Inferior shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit fine and are comfortable but fall apart after three months use. I purchased these shoes for daily walking and the top of the shoe began to peel and now has a hole. I contacted both Amazon and Vionic to inform them of the problem and nothing could be done to replace or get a refund for the shoes. A pair of shoes should last more than 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Perez

customer_reviews.title: good shoe but a bit too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size larger than what I usually wear (based on reviewers comments). They were still tight. I dont know if this is by design to allow for some stretching of the shoe. I have had them for several months now and they are good shoes with very substantial arch support. A bit pricey though. The plantar fasciitis in my left foot went away in a week.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Shields

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart!
customer_reviews.text: First time I have had trouble with this brand of Vionic shoe. Only been wearing for 3 months and they are falling apart. The leather is just peeling off the front. Normal everyday wear, nothing heavy duty or rough. Very disappointed. Not worth the money this time. Usually get at least 6 months to a year from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: TOE COVER SEPARATED AFTER 6 MONTHS OF USE !!! PURE GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: I don't hike, just walk. The front of the shoe where the treads curl up in to the toe came loose as if there wasn't enough glue. I'm sick and tired of this cheap Chinese junk!
customer_reviews.author: Al Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not to impressed yet
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 1/2 wide, went up to largest size offered, as recommended in reviews, which is a 13 wide. Width is good in both shoes, fits fine on right foot but tight in toe area on left foot. Also the insole padding feels rather thin. Hopefully they loosen up after some usage and will use some added gel insoles to see if that helps. However, the week that I have used them does seem to have helped with my heal pain.
customer_reviews.author: tpit

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality shoe.
customer_reviews.text: What a difference ! I'm older and my feet are wore out. I have been purchasing name brand shoes from sporting good stores for years. Seems like they are just getting crummer and crummer... It's ;ike as soon as they make a name for themselves as good shoes the go to pot. I have been told to buy inserts for my $85.00 new shoes if I want arch supports.. These vionics are shoes like I remember them. Pleased !
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Size is smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe size is too small. Caused a bruise under both toenails on the big toes. Order size 1/2 larger than what you normally wear. I can't wear these. I wore these only 3 times!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe— poor stitching.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes to help with the plantar fasciitis I have dealt with for over a year. They have great support and indeed have helped. I am giving them a 2 star though because after only a couple months of ownership, the stitching on one of the shoes is already fraying and coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: User12

customer_reviews.title: My husbands favorite sneaker
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable, and well worth the price. These shoe fits perfectly and helps with his planta facia. This is second pair ordered so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: Great orthopedic shoe for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis, plantar fasciitis and tendonitis in both feet and these shoes are fantastic, they allow me to walk virtually pain free. I walk around 3 miles a day, up to 10 at weekends, and whilst my issues are long going and probably won't ever go away completely I can't really walk well in any other foot wear, apart from shoes that I have the Vionic orthopedic soles in.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Bowler

customer_reviews.title: Too tight small for size
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes for a 3 mile walk. I ended up with blisters on both of my feet. I’m having to wear Sandals while my feet heal. They may be great shoes but not for me
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Horne

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable walking shoe I’ve ever owned. Sizing correctly: I thought I was a size 11 but got a EE wide and my size is 10.5. Much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Shanemeister

customer_reviews.title: Find what you like and stick with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these shoes. They started as Orthoheel and went to Vionic. They run a little narrow, so I get the wide type for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable good looking shoe. Seems to be helping plantar fasciitis. This is my new go to shoe for walking and commuting. Seems somewhat pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch H.

customer_reviews.title: These shoes were recommended for heel pain
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were recommended for heel pain, and so I took a chance. The insoles that came in them made their fit too tight, but since I have a vast collection of different insoles due to chronic bad feet, I just customized them and then they fit very well. Get a half or full size larger than you normally take if you want to wear them as they come. Heel pain is about 90% better. They seem to be a well made, sturdy shoe.
customer_reviews.author: pip

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy construction
customer_reviews.text: The good news is that they helped my plantar fasciitis quite a bit; they're stable walking shoes and help with pronation issues as well. The bad news is that they are shoddily constructed. The sole on one shoe started peeling about a week after the return period ended. Two weeks later, the sewn in lace eyelet on the other shoe frayed internally and pulled out of where it was sewn together. This after less than 100 miles of walking.
customer_reviews.author: Josephus Publicus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Support
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend Vionic products for people who need extra support whether it's for high arches or plantar fasciitis. Great styles, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Lerding

customer_reviews.title: Size is somewhat small
customer_reviews.text: My feet are feeling better since wearing these. I have plantar fasciitis in my right foot and the pain is nearly gone. I wear a size 8 and it seemed like these fit at first, but I wish I had bought the size 8.5 because they are a little tight and bother my feet after a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Elektronmann

customer_reviews.title: Size runs about 1 size too small and wide is like medium
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful, but you can believe previous reviews that they run small. I am a true 13 4e wide and they are tight on my front toes and hurt. I wore them around the house for a few days, then to church on Sunday and played in the church band for about 4 hours with practice & service. Next I wore it to work, and my feet where so much in pain I had to come home from work & change shoes. TOO TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.author: George Souza

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Runs really small.
customer_reviews.text: Had sent back a previously ordered pair--slightly different shoe,because it was too small. Ordered this one a 1/2 size up because the 12 was not available in the first ordered shoes. Loved these shoes, but they were REALLY too small. Smaller than the 11.5 in the first ordered shoes. Was afraid to order a 13. Sending back. Will try again with another shoe. LOVE the support the Orthaheel Tech gives.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Englert

customer_reviews.title: Far too Small
customer_reviews.text: Noticed that some people were ordering larger sizes and I wish that I had done that. The shoes that came were far to small and I couldn't put them on!
customer_reviews.author: Onheading

customer_reviews.title: No orthotics needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have a flat left foot, and have been using custom made orthotics in my shoes for 3 years now. I received these Orthoheels today, put them on without my orthotics, and they felt amazing. Ten minutes after I got them I wore them to the gym, where I walk a couple miles on the indoor track along with my workout, and am completely blown away from the support these gave my feet, and eliminated the need for the orthotic for my left foot. I will be buying more pairs of these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: don_wallace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent relief for my plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed, I have a bit of plantar fasciitis with my left foot. I ordered these shoes on a recommendation and am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: NicNExile

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, but don't last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband in January 2016 and by the end of March 2016 the sides had huge holes in them. These didn't even last 3 months. My husband loves the fit and says they were very comfortable. However, for $100 I'd expect them to last a least a little bit longer. I can't recommend these because of the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jessee B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I followed the advice in reviews and ordered a size large, and they fit. However, the fabric near the toes has torn. It didn't rip up from the seam, but split alongside the toe area. Pretty poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: pyroplop

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered women's Orthaheel tennis shoes but received notice they wouldn't arrive by the time I needed them. I was desperate since I was heading on a week long trip to Yosemite including miles of hiking. I wear a 9.5 regular women's shoe and ordered Men's 8 D. They fit beautifully and made the hiking doable. In fact, after a week of hiking and wearing these shoes, along with Plantar Fasciitis Compression Foot Sleeve MD (Set of 2) Pain Reducing Sock, I am experiencing the first consistent foot pain relief I've had in over a year! I'm a HUGE fan of these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: h-house

customer_reviews.title: Buy at least a size larger than you normally do....
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, except that even though I read the reviews and ordered a half size large, they are still a little small and bother my big toes. Otherwise I would have rated them at a five star..... Hopefully they'll stretch a bit over time....
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have a deteriorating ankle. This shoe provides alignment, support, and comfort. Vionic shoes are the only shoes I wear now . They were recommended by my doctor. Definitely better comfort than Nike, ASICS, puma, etc.
customer_reviews.author: scrablehead

customer_reviews.title: Glad I ordered one size up as recommended by the ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not understand why Vionic cannot get its act together on sizing. Glad I ordered one size up as recommended by the reviews rather than the 1/2 recommended by the manufacturer. That having been said, it is the most comfortable athletic shoe I have ever owned and it is stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Rainyboy

customer_reviews.title: Everything fine
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten these before, both black and white. I needed to bump up to wide from medium width, and the fit is right on.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: I had polio and the women's shoes are GREAT! My husband stands on his feet all day ...
customer_reviews.text: We only wear orthaheel shoes with vionic technology. I had polio and the women's shoes are GREAT! My husband stands on his feet all day at work and they really help him so much.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Sorg

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and solid but measurement way off.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and well-built but size is at least off one size and the wind is no bigger than a regular in another manufacturer the sole inserts looks nothing special either
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacements for my Birkenstocks since they don't make the ones I like anymore and wow I really like these . I'm a nurse and on my feet for 12 hours at a time and these shoes helped a lot the first day I wore them . The second day they were even better . I don't know how well they will hold up over time but so far I'm really liking them . Yes order a half size normal than you would normally but overall they are a really comfortable pair of shoes .
customer_reviews.author: Gary Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Caution regarding the size
customer_reviews.text: This 12M shoe was too small (too short). I tried wearing it for almost a year hoping it would break in, as the Othaheel men's walker it replaced was also a 12M and felt quite comfortable. I threw the new pair out this past week after concluding that it never going to provide a comfortable fit; disappointing for a $100 purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good looking shoe that made a lot of walking less painful. These fit the bill, and the slipped right on perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Pope Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple pairs of Vionic shoes and am very happy with all of them except for these. I originally got my normal size and the seemed small. I returned them for a 1/2 size larger and they still rub both my big toe and my little toe. There are seams that are not well padded enough to protect your little toe from rubbing every step you take. In my opinion, these are a complete failure by Vionic.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This my third pair. I where them every day for long walks. I usually wear a 9.5 or 10 in most brands, but learned from experience that with these Vionic walkers I need to order a size 10.5. They fit fine. Very comfortable with great arch support.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye to heel pain
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs a little small so that is why I give it 3 stars. My plantar fasciitis flared up again and NOTHING has helped except for these shoes. I definitely considering getting another pair. I suggest you get the next size up though if you go with these.
customer_reviews.author: lestat_memnoch

customer_reviews.title: Size problems
customer_reviews.text: You would think someone would call China and say, hey guys, put the 12 label on the 13 shoes....and so on...I mean it cost money for people to have to return the shoes and get the next size up. I just got mine (12) wore them around the house for 1/2 hour, they feel GREAT when walking!! But were so tight hurt when I was sitting down. I liked them so much ordered a pair of 13's with overnight delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Harper

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down hill
customer_reviews.text: I am so mad. I had these shoes for about a month. 2 days after the Return window was up, one split on the side at the sole, similar to everyone else's. What a terrible disappointment from a company that I have learned to rely on. I am hoping someone from Vionic contacts me to make this up. Otherwise, I will never buy another pair again. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: scott metzger

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for overpronator
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these sneakers for my son who has flat feet and extreme over pronation. He normally wears a 11 1/2 but after measuring his foot and using Orthoheel's size guide I chose the size 12 and they fit perfectly. They look great, just like any other sneaker but, for the 'orthoheel' label on the tongue (maybe they could put the label on the inside) and have made a dramatic difference in his walking. They also feel and appear to be made well but, since we've only had them a few weeks I can't rate how they'll last. However, we walk 2 miles 3-4 days a week and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ruella

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but that size thing is vexing... not attractive either.
customer_reviews.text: These would have been great if my toe didn't get smashed in them every day. They fit in every other way (instep, etc.) I followed other people's sizing recommendations which worked for the sandal but failed on the shoe. They look kind of Herman Munstery on your feet too. Otherwise the built in orthotic is great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Pozzuto

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Recommend ordering 1/2 size larger than you normally wear. I wear a 9 1/2 but ordered a 10 after reading reviews. They fit well. Not bad looking compared to other "ortho" shoes. They are comfortable but I am only wearing them for a few hours at a time during the break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hurtt

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes, purchased first week of October. Noticed the first week of January the uppers are separating from the sole at the toe. Very expensive to only last a few months. I want a replacement!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: New size "11"???
customer_reviews.text: Have owned and worn size 11's for years! Loved the fit. The "Vionic" shoe is supposed to be the same as the Orthaheel but it's clearly not! These 11's are a full size too small.
customer_reviews.author: 2Blessed2bStressed

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for heel pain!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great if you have a high arch and have issues with heel pain. This is my second pair and I love them!! My first pair lasted almost 2 years before they just wore out and the pain started to come back.
customer_reviews.author: J&SVaughan

product_meta.title: Vionic Women's Walker Classic Shoes
product_meta.description: Mens Orthaheel Walker with orthaheel orthotics plantar fasciitis walking shoe returns Podiatrist influenced design WhiteNavy
